edu.ucsb.cs56.drawings.utilities

Class GeneralPathWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.drawings.utilities.GeneralPathWrapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Shape
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CoffeeCup, CoffeeCup, House, House, Ipod, LightBulb, Pencil

    public class GeneralPathWrapper
extends Object
implements Shape
    Because GeneralPath is declared as "final", we can't extend it. That's inconvenient, because if we can declare shapes that extend GeneralPath, we get all of the methods of GeneralPath that implement the Shape interface. That allows us to do graphics transformations like translating, rotating and scaling (the Affine transforms). So, GeneralPathWrapper is a wrapper around a GeneralPath object that we can extend
    Version:
    CS56, Winter 2011, UCSB
    Author:
    P. Conrad

      GeneralPathWrapper() 
      GeneralPathWrapper(GeneralPath gp)
      If we already have a GeneralPath, we can wrap it.

      Returns an integer Rectangle that completely encloses the Shape.
      Rectangle2D getBounds2D()

      Returns an iterator object that iterates along the Shape boundary and provides access to the geometry of the Shape outline.
      PathIterator getPathIterator(AffineTransform at, double flatness)
      Returns an iterator object that iterates along the Shape boundary and provides access to a flattened view of the Shape outline geometry.

      Tests if the interior of the Shape intersects the interior of a specified rectangular area.
